levels.label: entry
levels.description: Forming basic diagonal and horizontal joining strokes between two letters in isolation.
levels.example_task: Practise joining these letter pairs: in, an, un, at. Use the diagonal joining stroke.
levels.example_response: (Writes the letter pairs with recognisable joining strokes, though size and spacing may be inconsistent.)
common_errors: Lifting the pen between letters rather than maintaining the join
Making the joining stroke but distorting the letter shapes

levels.label: developing
levels.description: Using joining strokes consistently in short, familiar words during handwriting practice.
levels.example_task: Write these words in joined handwriting: run, man, fish, stop, think.
levels.example_response: (Words written in joined handwriting with most joins formed correctly. Letters are mostly consistent in size.)
common_errors: Joining letters that are best left unjoined (e.g., after certain letters like b, p, or before s)
Correct joins in practice but reverting to print in independent writing

levels.label: expected
levels.description: Using diagonal and horizontal joining strokes fluently in independent writing, knowing which letters are best left unjoined.
levels.example_task: Write a paragraph about your weekend in your best joined handwriting. Remember which letters don't need joining.
levels.example_response: (Paragraph written in fluent joined handwriting. Most joins are correct and consistent. Letters after round letters like b, p and before s are appropriately left unjoined.)
common_errors: Inconsistent use of joins — some words joined, others printed in the same piece
Sacrificing letter formation quality in order to maintain joins

levels.label: greater_depth
levels.description: Writing fluently in a consistent joined style across all writing tasks, maintaining legibility and appropriate speed.
levels.example_task: Write a timed paragraph (3 minutes) about your favourite book in joined handwriting. Aim for both speed and legibility.
levels.example_response: (Writes a substantial paragraph in consistent joined handwriting, maintaining letter size, spacing and join accuracy at a reasonable speed. The writing is legible to others.)
common_errors: Speed compromising legibility, particularly with ascenders and descenders
Inconsistency in letter size when writing at speed

levels.label: entry
levels.description: Writing letters on a line with most letters sitting on the baseline, though with inconsistent sizing.
levels.example_task: Copy this sentence onto lined paper, making sure your letters sit on the line: 'The quick brown fox jumped.'
levels.example_response: (Letters sit on the baseline. Some inconsistency in letter height but overall readable.)
common_errors: Letters floating above or sinking below the baseline
All letters the same height — not distinguishing ascenders, descenders and x-height letters

levels.label: developing
levels.description: Writing with more consistent letter sizing, distinguishing between ascenders, descenders and x-height letters.
levels.example_task: Write this sentence, paying attention to the different sizes of letters: 'The happy girl played by the pond.'
levels.example_response: (Ascenders (h, l, d, b) are clearly taller than x-height letters. Descenders (y, p, g) drop below the line. Spacing between words is mostly even.)
common_errors: Ascenders not reaching the full height line
Descenders not dropping far enough below the baseline to be distinct

levels.label: expected
levels.description: Writing with consistent letter size, even spacing, and parallel downstrokes across extended pieces of work.
levels.example_task: Write a full page of your story draft. Focus on keeping your handwriting consistent throughout — even letter sizes, regular spacing, and neat presentation.
levels.example_response: (A full page of writing with consistent letter formation throughout. Downstrokes are parallel. Spacing between words is even. Ascenders and descenders are correctly proportioned. The writing is clearly legible.)
common_errors: Starting neatly but deteriorating as the writing continues and fatigue sets in
Inconsistent word spacing — some words crowded together, others widely spaced

levels.label: greater_depth
levels.description: Producing handwriting of a high standard consistently across all subjects and contexts, self-monitoring and self-correcting for quality.
levels.example_task: Compare your handwriting at the start and end of this piece. Is it consistent throughout? Identify anything you would improve.
levels.example_response: 'My handwriting is mostly consistent but I notice that my letter d gets smaller towards the end. The spacing stays even throughout. I could improve the height of my ascenders in the last paragraph — they are slightly shorter than in the first paragraph.'
common_errors: Not noticing deterioration in quality across a longer piece
Focusing only on one aspect of handwriting quality and ignoring others
